resource.name: HPI Location
resource.description: A physical location from which health goods and/or services are provided.  They are also referred to as an HPI Facility.

resource.name: HPI Organization
resource.description: An entity that provides services of interest to, or is involved in, the business of health care service provision.

resource.name: HPI Practitioner
resource.description: The practitioner exposed by the HPI. This is the person who delivers healthcare or healthcare related services.

resource.name: HPI Practitioner role
resource.description: The practitioner role exposed by the HPI. Used to connect Practitioners with Organizations and Locations, indicating the role they have. A single Practitioner can have roles with multiple organizations.

resource.name: Common NZ Address datatype
resource.description: Adds building name, suburb, domicile code and geocode to the Address datatype

resource.name: Esam_id
resource.description: The id from eSam

resource.name: Electronic connection point
resource.description: Describes the capabilities for electronic interaction

resource.name: A facility involved in healthcare
resource.description: An actual physical location. Represented by a Location model in FHIR

resource.name: An Organization involved in healthcare
resource.description: An Organization involved in healthcare

resource.name: Healthcare provider
resource.description: A person who delivers care

resource.name: Provider role
resource.description: The role of a provider in a care delivery setting

resource.name: District Health Board Code
resource.description: A coded type for a DHB.

resource.description: A coded type for an alias name for organisation.

resource.description: The role a practitioner holds.

resource.name: District Health Board Code
resource.description: District Health Board code table.

resource.name: Ethnicity New Zealand Standard Classification 2005 (level 4)
resource.description: Ethnicity is a key social factor used with other topics in describing the New Zealand population. Information collected on ethnicity is used to inform, plan, and evaluate services and policies by a wide range of organisations, local authorities and government agencies.

resource.name: HPI Additional Authorisation
resource.description: Additional authorisations that a practitioner is authorised to practice or prescribe.

resource.name: HPI Alias Type
resource.description: A coded type for an alias name.

resource.name: HPI Country Code
resource.description: Supplementary country codes to extend ISO3166-1.

resource.name: Location Type
resource.description: A coded value for location type.

resource.name: Organisation Type
resource.description: A coded value for organisation type.

resource.name: HPI PractitionerRole status reason
resource.description: The reason for the current status of PractitionerRole.

resource.name: HPI Registration Status
resource.description: The code list represents the current practicing status of the Provider Person as per their registration with an RA or a health worker source.

resource.name: HPI Registration Type
resource.description: A code to identify the type of professional registration the healthcare provider person has been assigned.

resource.name: HPI Scope of Practice
resource.description: A classification of the type or range of health services that a practitioner is authorised to provide, as determined by the Responsible Authority or other statutory authority (e.g. PHARMAC), that is, what the practitioner can or cannot do. It includes Scope of Practice as defined by the Health Practitioners Competence Assurance Act 2003, any special authorisations granted, and any conditions or limitations imposed by the Responsible Authority.

resource.name: ISO3166-1 two character country code
resource.description: The purpose of ISO 3166 is to define internationally recognized codes of letters and/or numbers that we can use when we refer to countries and their subdivisions. However, it does not define the names of countries â€“ this information comes from United Nations sources (Terminology Bulletin Country Names and the Country and Region Codes for Statistical Use maintained by the United Nations Statistics Divisions).

resource.name: ISO 639-3:2007 (3-alpha language code)
resource.description: ISO 639-3 is a set of codes that defines three-letter identifiers for all known human languages.

resource.name: Name Prefix
resource.description: A coded type for name prefixes.

resource.name: CapabilityStatement
resource.description: Represents API exposed by HPI

resource.name: Search on DHB
resource.description: Returns resources - eg Location -  that are in the catchment of the specified DHB

resource.description: Search the Practitioner by birthdate
